{"comments": {"id": 15681, "count": 144, "talk_id": 1583}, "threadId": 15681, "requested_language_english_name": "English", "current_talk": "1583", "description": "As Vicki Arroyo says, it's time to prepare our homes and cities for our changing climate, with its increased risk of flooding, drought and uncertainty. She illustrates this inspiring talk with bold projects from cities all over the world -- local examples of thinking ahead.", "event": "TEDGlobal 2012", "language": "en", "language_swap": false, "name": "Vicki Arroyo: Let's prepare for our new climate", "slug": "vicki_arroyo_let_s_prepare_for_our_new_climate", "series_slug": null, "speakers": [{"id": "1306", "slug": "vicki_arroyo", "is_published": true, "firstname": "Vicki", "lastname": "Arroyo", "middleinitial": "", "title": "", "description": "Environmental policy influencer", "photo_url": "https://pe.tedcdn.com/images/ted/65551c83f84dac9130824c65e643fcd4d1ee8925_254x191.jpg", "whatotherssay": "One of Grist's seven 'favorite journos and wonks.'", "whotheyare": "Vicki Arroyo uses environmental law and her background in biology and ecology to help prepare for global climate change.", "whylisten": "

The climate is quickly changing. Scientists increasingly talk of a new period in the Earth's history, the "anthropocene", in which human impact on the planet has become dominant. Yet we remain unprepared to deal with the consequences: specifically, the disruption and cost. Lawyer Vicki Arroyo, the executive director of the Georgetown Climate Center, works on climate mitigation and adaptation policies as viable solutions to climate change’s inevitable disruptions to current practices. Using the best available science, Arroyo collaborates with US policymakers at both the state and federal level to develop "planetary management" strategies.

For a through (and constantly updated) toolkit of adaptation resources, visit the Georgetown Climate Center >>

Read Vicki's essay on preparing for future disasters in the wake of Hurricane Sandy >>

The Clearinghouse contains more than 1,000 resources.", "note": "", "link_url": "http://www.AdaptationClearinghouse.com", "position": null, "is_pdf": false, "eyebrow": null}, {"label": "EXPLORE", "headline": "Adaptation Tool Kit: Sea-Level Rise and Coastal Land Use", "blurb": "This toolkit explores 18 different land-use tools that can be used to preemptively respond to the threats posed by sea level rise to both public and private coastal development and infrastructure, and strives to assist governments in determining which tools to employ to meet their unique socioeconomic and political contexts.", "note": "Jessica Grannis, October 2011", "link_url": "http://www.georgetownclimate.org/adaptation-tool-kit-sea-level-rise-and-coastal-land-use", "position": null, "is_pdf": false, "eyebrow": null}, {"label": "EXPLORE", "headline": "Adapting to Urban Heat: A Tool Kit for Local Governments", "blurb": "This report is designed to help local governments reduce the effects of increased heat on their communities and citizens. It provides an analytic tool for policymakers to consider a combination of four built-environment changes (cool roofs, green roofs, cool pavements and urban forestry), providing clear criteria for selecting among these approaches.", "note": "Sara P. Hoverter, August 2012", "link_url": "http://www.law.georgetown.edu/academics/academic-programs/clinical-programs/our-clinics/HIP/upload/Urban-Heat-Toolkit_RD2.pdf", "position": null, "is_pdf": false, "eyebrow": null}]}]}, "more_resources": [{"status": "approved", "headline": "We need to talk about climate change. "", "description": "Environmental policy influencer", "photo_url": "https://pe.tedcdn.com/images/ted/65551c83f84dac9130824c65e643fcd4d1ee8925_254x191.jpg", "whatotherssay": "One of Grist's seven 'favorite journos and wonks.'", "whotheyare": "Vicki Arroyo uses environmental law and her background in biology and ecology to help prepare for global climate change.", "whylisten": "

The climate is quickly changing. Scientists increasingly talk of a new period in the Earth's history, the "anthropocene", in which human impact on the planet has become dominant. Yet we remain unprepared to deal with the consequences: specifically, the disruption and cost. Lawyer Vicki Arroyo, the executive director of the Georgetown Climate Center, works on climate mitigation and adaptation policies as viable solutions to climate change’s inevitable disruptions to current practices. Using the best available science, Arroyo collaborates with US policymakers at both the state and federal level to develop "planetary management" strategies.

For a through (and constantly updated) toolkit of adaptation resources, visit the Georgetown Climate Center >>

Read Vicki's essay on preparing for future disasters in the wake of Hurricane Sandy >>

"}], "speaker_name": "Vicki Arroyo", "tags": ["cities", "climate change", "global issues", "weather"], "title": "Let's prepare for our new climate", "video_type": {"id": "1", "name": "TED Stage Talk"}, "viewed_count": 1139311}]}
author: Vicki_Arroyo;
title: Let's prepare for our new climate
